title: Event and Raffle System
project_description: The Event and Raffle System was designed and developed for Juan D. Nepomuceno (JDN) to streamline the management of events and allow users to actively participate. The system enables event organizers to create and manage events, while participants can register, view event details, and engage in raffles. This system simplifies the process for both organizers and participants, ensuring seamless event execution with an integrated raffle component for added excitement.
problem: Before the system was introduced, event organizers faced challenges in managing attendee participation and event logistics. Tracking participant registration, handling event updates, and organizing raffles for attendees were all done manually, which resulted in inefficiencies, delayed communication, and a disorganized event flow.
solution: The Event Raffle and Event System automated the entire process, providing a centralized platform where organizers could easily create events, manage registrations, and handle event-related tasks. Participants were able to register online, receive timely event updates, and automatically enroll in raffles. The systemâ€™s raffle feature ensured fairness and transparency in selecting winners, while simplifying participant management and event tracking for the organizers.

title: Car Rental System
project_description: A web-based system designed to streamline the car rental process for employees, allowing them to create tickets, check availability, and manage bookings.
problem: The manual process for requesting rides for official business was labor-intensive, time-consuming, and susceptible to errors, lacking an efficient method for tracking vehicle availability.
solution: Implemented a web-based system that enables users to digitally submit ride requests, allowing supervisors to approve or decline them. The administrative department can then allocate available cars and drivers based on real-time data. The system also features automated notifications for upcoming rides and returns, facilitating streamlined tracking and management.

title: Raffle System
project_description: An automated raffle system that enables easy setup and execution of company raffles with an integrated prize distribution and management system.
problem: The old raffle system required manual data entry into the database, which was time-consuming and prone to errors.
solution: Redesigned the raffle system to be dynamic and user-friendly, allowing for easy uploading, removal, resetting, and setup of prizes, streamlining the entire process.

title: Helpdesk System Upgrade
project_description: An enhanced helpdesk system to manage support requests across multiple departments, improving request tracking and service response.
problem: The previous helpdesk system could not accommodate requests from various departments, leading to miscommunication and delays in issue resolution.
solution: Enhanced the helpdesk system to cater to multiple departments by introducing specific service categories. Each department can now assign their own team, create custom categories, and personalize email responses. The system also allows for ticket archiving, and the daily reports displayed on the dashboard have been optimized to improve resolution speed and enhance transparency.

title: Asset Inventory System
project_description: A revamped asset inventory system that uses QR codes for real-time asset tracking and easy management.
problem: The old asset inventory system was slow to fetch records, had multiple duplications, required too many manual inputs, contained inconsistent data, and lacked integration with other technologies.
solution: The asset inventory system was reinvented to fetch only the necessary data based on user needs. It includes multiple input validations, customizable categories, and features for issuing, returning, preventive maintenance (with checks for maintenance periods), approval for disposal, and archiving of previous data. The system also allows for adding spare parts for each asset, generates reports of asset activity, creates QR codes for asset tags, and can scan device barcodes or QR codes for receiving assets for maintenance.

title: Laravel Project Upgrade & Clean-up
project_description: Upgraded an existing Laravel project from version 5.6 to version 11, including refactoring, directory cleanup, and performance optimization.
problem: The project had controllers, models, and public files placed in improper folders, duplicated data, inconsistent usage of scripts and CSS, and was using Laravel 5.6, which made it difficult to implement modern features and security updates.
solution: The project was cleaned up by organizing files in proper folders, transferring public attachments to a file server, upgrading to a cleaner and more modern UI to enhance the user experience, and upgrading from Laravel 5.6 to 10.
